lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* This is the parent exception of all exceptions created in this duke program.
* This exception is thrown when the user input does not match valid command.
super("Sorry, I don't understand what you mean ><");
* This exception is thrown when the deadline command is of the incorrect format.
super("(`) Uh oh... make sure your deadline has a description and date");
* This exception is thrown when the event command is of the incorrect format.
super("(`) Uh oh... improper event format!");
* This exception is thrown when no/more than one keyword is provided
* when user enters the find command.
super("(`) Uh oh...please provide exactly one keyword");
* This exception is thrown when start datetime is after end datetime when creating
super("(`) Uh oh... start must be after end!");
* This exception is thrown when the task id provided is out of range
* when attempting actions such as delete, mark and unmark.
* This exception is thrown when no description is provided when attempting to
super("(`) Uh oh... please add a description");
* This exception is thrown when no end datetime is provided when attempting
super("(`) Uh oh... please add an end date");
* This exception is thrown when no start datetime is provided when attempting

* This exception is thrown when no task id is provided when attempting actions
* such as delete, mark and unmark.
super("(`) Uh oh... please provide a taskID");
